data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to update your current bounce forwarding mail settings.**

Enabling the Forward Bounce setting allows you to specify an `email` address to which bounce reports will be forwarded.

You can also configure the Forward Spam mail settings in the [Mail Settings section of the Twilio SendGrid App](https://app.sendgrid.com/settings/mail_settings).
data.description_suggestion: Updates the Forward Bounce mail setting to configure bounce report forwarding. Accepts an email address and enabled status in the request body. When enabled, bounce reports will be forwarded to the specified email address. Returns the updated Forward Bounce configuration with the email address and enabled status. Requires authentication via API key.
data.reasoning: The current description lacks clarity about expected inputs (email and enabled fields) and outputs (what the response contains). Added specific details about request body structure, response content, and authentication requirement to improve AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to update your current Forward Spam mail settings.**

Enabling the Forward Spam setting allows you to specify `email` addresses to which spam reports will be forwarded. You can set multiple addresses by passing this endpoint a comma separated list of emails in a single string.

```
{
  "email": "address1@example.com, address2@exapmle.com",
  "enabled": true
}
```

The Forward Spam setting may also be used to receive emails sent to `abuse@` and `postmaster@` role addresses if you have authenticated your domain.

For example, if you authenticated `example.com` as your root domain and set a custom return path of `sub` for that domain, you could turn on Forward Spam, and any emails sent to `abuse@sub.example.com` or `postmaster@sub.example.com` would be forwarded to the email address you entered in the `email` field.

You can authenticate your domain using the "Authenticate a domain" endpoint or in the [Sender Authentication section of the Twilio SendGrid App](https://app.sendgrid.com/settings/sender_auth). You can also configure the Forward Spam mail settings in the [Mail Settings section of the Twilio SendGrid App](https://app.sendgrid.com/settings/mail_settings).
data.description_suggestion: Updates the Forward Spam mail setting to configure spam report forwarding. Accepts an email address (supporting comma-separated multiple addresses) and enabled status in the request body. When enabled, spam reports and emails to abuse@ and postmaster@ role addresses (if domain is authenticated) will be forwarded to the specified email address(es). Returns the updated Forward Spam configuration with the email address(es) and enabled status. Requires authentication via API key.
data.reasoning: The description is comprehensive about inputs and domain context, but lacks explicit information about what the response contains. Added clarity about the return value structure to improve AI agent understanding of the operation's effects.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to update your current legacy email template settings.**

This setting refers to our original email templates. We currently support more fully featured [Dynamic Transactional Templates](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/sending-email/how-to-send-an-email-with-dynamic-transactional-templates/).

The legacy email template setting wraps an HTML template around your email content. This can be useful for sending out marketing email and/or other HTML formatted messages. For instructions on using legacy templates, see how to ["Create and Edit Legacy Transactional Templates](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/sending-email/create-and-edit-legacy-transactional-templates/). For help migrating to our current template system, see ["Migrating from Legacy Templates"](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/sending-email/migrating-from-legacy-templates/).
data.description_suggestion: Updates the legacy email template mail setting. Accepts a template ID and enabled status in the request body to configure HTML template wrapping for outgoing emails. Returns the updated template configuration with the template ID and enabled status. Note: Legacy templates are deprecated in favor of Dynamic Transactional Templates. Requires authentication via API key.
data.reasoning: The current description provides context about legacy templates but lacks specific details about what inputs are expected (template ID, enabled field) and what the response contains. Added clarity about request/response structure and deprecation context to improve AI agent interpretability.

**This endpoint allows you to retrieve your current legacy email template settings.**

This setting refers to our original email templates. We currently support more fully featured [Dynamic Transactional Templates](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/sending-email/how-to-send-an-email-with-dynamic-transactional-templates/).

The legacy email template setting wraps an HTML template around your email content. This can be useful for sending out marketing email and/or other HTML formatted messages. For instructions on using legacy templates, see how to ["Create and Edit Legacy Transactional Templates](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/sending-email/create-and-edit-legacy-transactional-templates/). For help migrating to our current template system, see ["Migrating from Legacy Templates"](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/sending-email/migrating-from-legacy-templates/).
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the current legacy email template mail setting configuration. Returns the template ID and enabled status indicating whether legacy template wrapping is active. Note: Legacy templates are deprecated in favor of Dynamic Transactional Templates. Requires authentication via API key.
data.reasoning: The summary is clear, but the description lacks explicit information about what the response contains (template ID and enabled status). Added clarity about return values and deprecation context to improve AI agent understanding of the operation's output.

message: Operation 'UpdateAddressWhitelist' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details. Description is comprehensive but lacks explicit information about what is returned by the operation. Added clarity about return value and emphasized that this is a partial update operation to improve AI agent understanding of when and how to use this endpoint.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to update your current email address whitelist settings.**

You can select whether or not this setting should be enabled by assigning the `enabled` field a `true` or `false` value.

Passing only the `enabled` field to this endpoint will not alter your current `list` of whitelist entries. However, any modifications to your `list` of entries will overwrite the entire list. For this reason, you must included all existing entries you wish to retain in your `list` in addition to any new entries you intend to add. To remove one or more `list` entries, pass a `list` with only the entries you wish to retain.

You should not add generic domains such as `gmail.com` or `yahoo.com`  in your `list` because your emails will not honor recipients' unsubscribes. This may cause a legal violation of [CAN-SPAM](https://sendgrid.com/docs/glossary/can-spam/) and could damage your sending reputation.

The Address Whitelist setting allows you to specify email addresses or domains for which mail should never be suppressed.

For example, if you own the domain `example.com`, and one or more of your recipients use `email@example.com` addresses, placing `example.com` in the address whitelist setting instructs Twilio SendGrid to ignore all bounces, blocks, and unsubscribes logged for that domain. In other words, all bounces, blocks, and unsubscribes will still be sent to `example.com` as if they were sent under normal sending conditions.
data.description_suggestion: Updates your email address whitelist settings to specify domains or addresses where mail should never be suppressed. You can enable/disable the setting via the `enabled` field and manage the whitelist entries via the `list` field. Note: modifications to the `list` field overwrite the entire list, so include all entries you wish to retain plus any new entries. Partial updates are supportedonly provided fields will be modified. Returns the updated address whitelist configuration. Avoid adding generic domains like `gmail.com` or `yahoo.com` to prevent CAN-SPAM violations and reputation damage.
data.reasoning: Description is comprehensive but lacks explicit information about what is returned by the operation. Added clarity about return value and emphasized that this is a partial update operation to improve AI agent understanding of when and how to use this endpoint.

message: Operation 'UpdateBouncePurge' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details. Description provides excellent domain context and explains hard vs. soft bounces clearly, but lacks explicit information about what the operation returns. Added return value clarification to improve AI agent understanding of the operation's complete behavior.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to update your current Bounce Purge mail settings.**

The Bounce Purge mail metting allows you to configure the maximum age of contacts in your hard and soft bounce suppressions lists. All contacts older than their respective configured age are deleted.

A hard bounce occurs when an email message has been returned to the sender because the recipient's address is invalid. A hard bounce might occur because the domain name doesn't exist or because the recipient is unknown.

A soft bounce occurs when an email message reaches the recipient's mail server but is bounced back undelivered before it actually reaches the recipient. A soft bounce might occur because the recipient's inbox is full.

You can also manage this setting in the [Mail Settings section of the Twilio SendGrid App](https://app.sendgrid.com/settings/mail_settings). You can manage your bounces manually using the [Bounces API](https://docs.sendgrid.com/api-reference/bounces-api) or the [Bounces menu in the Twilio SendGrid App](https://app.sendgrid.com/suppressions/bounces).
data.description_suggestion: Updates your Bounce Purge mail settings to configure the maximum age of contacts in your hard and soft bounce suppression lists. Contacts older than the configured age are automatically deleted. Hard bounces occur when a recipient's address is invalid (domain doesn't exist or recipient unknown). Soft bounces occur when mail reaches the server but is returned undelivered before reaching the recipient (e.g., full inbox). Returns the updated Bounce Purge configuration. You can also manage this setting via the Mail Settings section of the Twilio SendGrid App or the Bounces API.
data.reasoning: Description provides excellent domain context and explains hard vs. soft bounces clearly, but lacks explicit information about what the operation returns. Added return value clarification to improve AI agent understanding of the operation's complete behavior.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to update your current Footer mail settings.**

The Footer setting will insert a custom footer at the bottom of your text and HTML email message bodies.

You can insert your HTML or plain text directly using this endpoint, or you can create the footer using the [Mail Settings menu in the Twilio SendGrid App](https://app.sendgrid.com/settings/mail_settings).
data.description_suggestion: Updates your Footer mail settings to insert a custom footer at the bottom of text and HTML email message bodies. Accepts HTML or plain text content via the request body. Supports partial updatesonly provided fields will be modified. Returns the updated Footer configuration with the enabled status and footer content. You can also manage this setting via the Mail Settings menu in the Twilio SendGrid App.
data.reasoning: Description lacks clarity about what input fields are expected (HTML vs. plain text structure) and what the operation returns. Added details about input format, partial update support, and return value to improve AI agent understanding of how to construct requests and interpret responses.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to update your current bounce forwarding mail settings.**

Enabling the Forward Bounce setting allows you to specify an `email` address to which bounce reports will be forwarded.

You can also configure the Forward Spam mail settings in the [Mail Settings section of the Twilio SendGrid App](https://app.sendgrid.com/settings/mail_settings).
data.description_suggestion: Updates the Forward Bounce mail setting to configure bounce report forwarding. Accepts an email address and enabled status in the request body. When enabled, bounce reports will be forwarded to the specified email address. Returns the updated Forward Bounce configuration with the email address and enabled status. Requires authentication via API key.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to update your current Forward Spam mail settings.**

Enabling the Forward Spam setting allows you to specify `email` addresses to which spam reports will be forwarded. You can set multiple addresses by passing this endpoint a comma separated list of emails in a single string.

```
{
  "email": "address1@example.com, address2@exapmle.com",
  "enabled": true
}
```

The Forward Spam setting may also be used to receive emails sent to `abuse@` and `postmaster@` role addresses if you have authenticated your domain.

For example, if you authenticated `example.com` as your root domain and set a custom return path of `sub` for that domain, you could turn on Forward Spam, and any emails sent to `abuse@sub.example.com` or `postmaster@sub.example.com` would be forwarded to the email address you entered in the `email` field.

You can authenticate your domain using the "Authenticate a domain" endpoint or in the [Sender Authentication section of the Twilio SendGrid App](https://app.sendgrid.com/settings/sender_auth). You can also configure the Forward Spam mail settings in the [Mail Settings section of the Twilio SendGrid App](https://app.sendgrid.com/settings/mail_settings).
data.description_suggestion: Updates the Forward Spam mail setting to configure spam report forwarding. Accepts an email address (supporting comma-separated multiple addresses) and enabled status in the request body. When enabled, spam reports and emails to abuse@ and postmaster@ role addresses (if domain is authenticated) will be forwarded to the specified email address(es). Returns the updated Forward Spam configuration with the email address(es) and enabled status. Requires authentication via API key.
data.reasoning: The description is comprehensive about inputs and domain context, but lacks explicit information about what the response contains. Added clarity about the return value structure to improve AI agent understanding of the operation's effects.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to update your current legacy email template settings.**

This setting refers to our original email templates. We currently support more fully featured [Dynamic Transactional Templates](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/sending-email/how-to-send-an-email-with-dynamic-transactional-templates/).

The legacy email template setting wraps an HTML template around your email content. This can be useful for sending out marketing email and/or other HTML formatted messages. For instructions on using legacy templates, see how to ["Create and Edit Legacy Transactional Templates](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/sending-email/create-and-edit-legacy-transactional-templates/). For help migrating to our current template system, see ["Migrating from Legacy Templates"](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/sending-email/migrating-from-legacy-templates/).
data.description_suggestion: Updates the legacy email template mail setting. Accepts a template ID and enabled status in the request body to configure HTML template wrapping for outgoing emails. Returns the updated template configuration with the template ID and enabled status. Note: Legacy templates are deprecated in favor of Dynamic Transactional Templates. Requires authentication via API key.
data.reasoning: The current description provides context about legacy templates but lacks specific details about what inputs are expected (template ID, enabled field) and what the response contains. Added clarity about request/response structure and deprecation context to improve AI agent interpretability.

This setting refers to our original email templates. We currently support more fully featured [Dynamic Transactional Templates](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/sending-email/how-to-send-an-email-with-dynamic-transactional-templates/).

The legacy email template setting wraps an HTML template around your email content. This can be useful for sending out marketing email and/or other HTML formatted messages. For instructions on using legacy templates, see how to ["Create and Edit Legacy Transactional Templates](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/sending-email/create-and-edit-legacy-transactional-templates/). For help migrating to our current template system, see ["Migrating from Legacy Templates"](https://sendgrid.com/docs/ui/sending-email/migrating-from-legacy-templates/).

message: Operation 'UpdateAddressWhitelist' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details. Description is comprehensive but lacks explicit information about what is returned by the operation. data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to update your current email address whitelist settings.**

You can select whether or not this setting should be enabled by assigning the `enabled` field a `true` or `false` value.

Passing only the `enabled` field to this endpoint will not alter your current `list` of whitelist entries. However, any modifications to your `list` of entries will overwrite the entire list. For this reason, you must included all existing entries you wish to retain in your `list` in addition to any new entries you intend to add. To remove one or more `list` entries, pass a `list` with only the entries you wish to retain.

You should not add generic domains such as `gmail.com` or `yahoo.com`  in your `list` because your emails will not honor recipients' unsubscribes. This may cause a legal violation of [CAN-SPAM](https://sendgrid.com/docs/glossary/can-spam/) and could damage your sending reputation.

The Address Whitelist setting allows you to specify email addresses or domains for which mail should never be suppressed.

For example, if you own the domain `example.com`, and one or more of your recipients use `email@example.com` addresses, placing `example.com` in the address whitelist setting instructs Twilio SendGrid to ignore all bounces, blocks, and unsubscribes logged for that domain. In other words, all bounces, blocks, and unsubscribes will still be sent to `example.com` as if they were sent under normal sending conditions.
data.description_suggestion: Updates your email address whitelist settings to specify domains or addresses where mail should never be suppressed. You can enable/disable the setting via the `enabled` field and manage the whitelist entries via the `list` field. Note: modifications to the `list` field overwrite the entire list, so include all entries you wish to retain plus any new entries. Partial updates are supportedonly provided fields will be modified. Returns the updated address whitelist configuration. Avoid adding generic domains like `gmail.com` or `yahoo.com` to prevent CAN-SPAM violations and reputation damage.
data.reasoning: Description is comprehensive but lacks explicit information about what is returned by the operation. Added clarity about return value and emphasized that this is a partial update operation to improve AI agent understanding of when and how to use this endpoint.

message: Operation 'UpdateBouncePurge' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details. Description provides excellent domain context and explains hard vs. soft bounces clearly, but lacks explicit information about what the operation returns. Added return value clarification to improve AI agent understanding of the operation's complete behavior.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to update your current Bounce Purge mail settings.**

The Bounce Purge mail metting allows you to configure the maximum age of contacts in your hard and soft bounce suppressions lists. All contacts older than their respective configured age are deleted.

A hard bounce occurs when an email message has been returned to the sender because the recipient's address is invalid. A hard bounce might occur because the domain name doesn't exist or because the recipient is unknown.

A soft bounce occurs when an email message reaches the recipient's mail server but is bounced back undelivered before it actually reaches the recipient. A soft bounce might occur because the recipient's inbox is full.

You can also manage this setting in the [Mail Settings section of the Twilio SendGrid App](https://app.sendgrid.com/settings/mail_settings). You can manage your bounces manually using the [Bounces API](https://docs.sendgrid.com/api-reference/bounces-api) or the [Bounces menu in the Twilio SendGrid App](https://app.sendgrid.com/suppressions/bounces).
data.description_suggestion: Updates your Bounce Purge mail settings to configure the maximum age of contacts in your hard and soft bounce suppression lists. Contacts older than the configured age are automatically deleted. Hard bounces occur when a recipient's address is invalid (domain doesn't exist or recipient unknown). Soft bounces occur when mail reaches the server but is returned undelivered before reaching the recipient (e.g., full inbox). Returns the updated Bounce Purge configuration. You can also manage this setting via the Mail Settings section of the Twilio SendGrid App or the Bounces API.
data.reasoning: Description provides excellent domain context and explains hard vs. soft bounces clearly, but lacks explicit information about what the operation returns. Added return value clarification to improve AI agent understanding of the operation's complete behavior.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to update your current Footer mail settings.**

The Footer setting will insert a custom footer at the bottom of your text and HTML email message bodies.

You can insert your HTML or plain text directly using this endpoint, or you can create the footer using the [Mail Settings menu in the Twilio SendGrid App](https://app.sendgrid.com/settings/mail_settings).
data.description_suggestion: Updates your Footer mail settings to insert a custom footer at the bottom of text and HTML email message bodies. Accepts HTML or plain text content via the request body. Supports partial updatesonly provided fields will be modified. Returns the updated Footer configuration with the enabled status and footer content. You can also manage this setting via the Mail Settings menu in the Twilio SendGrid App.

Added details about input format, partial update support, and return value to improve AI agent understanding of how to construct requests and interpret responses.
